title: Minimum Number of Steps to Make Two Strings Anagram II
description: Given two strings s1 and s2, return the minimum number of steps required to make s1 and s2 anagrams of each other. In a single step, you can delete either one character from s1 or s2. An anagram of a string is another string that contains the same characters, only the order of characters can be different. Thus, to turn the strings into anagrams, you may need to delete extra characters from both strings.
input_format: Two strings s1 and s2 where 1 <= s1.length, s2.length <= 10^5.
output_format: An integer representing the minimum number of steps needed.
constraints: s1 and s2 consist of lowercase English letters.

examples.explanation: Delete one 'b' from s1 or one 'a' from s2 to make both strings anagrams.
Delete 'c', 'd', 'e' from s1 and 'a', 'b' from s2 for both strings to be empty.

hints: Consider using frequency counts of characters.
The steps required will depend on the differences in character counts.
